I hate those shiny "fact" videos so much because there's never any actual research or logic put into them. Most of the time it's just "did u know that the Masuda Method exists???" and then saying le rare mark antique sinistea is the rarest mon ever.
Case in point, I skimmed through picrel and they put Shedinja into the "Free" tier because "you get it for free when you evolve a shiny Nincada", and then they put Genesect into the "hard" tier even though it has 5% shiny chance in the only place you can hunt it.

I spent like 2 weeks researching and editing my own version with actual statistical rarity and it pulled an easy ~200k views on my account with <500 subs because I guess videos about shiny pokemon do insanely well in the youtube algorithm.

>>52725142
>. What can you do with him now that he is the best?

The same thing every anime on floating timeline does.
The problem with you and some other neet is that they kept seeing Pokemon as a plot oriented narrative driven shonen type anime like Digimon or Beyblade but in actuality is a slice of life comedy with adventure and battle. It can have narrative driven arc like Doreamon or Crayon Shinchan but it can't be a narrative driven show. Specially since Game-Freak keep making it hard to have underdog protagonist and this is why every Pokespe protagonist tends to a Gary Stu.

Ash winning the PWC just made it easier to be a slice of life adventure comedy anime because there is no baggage anymore. Writers just need bring back Brock with a De-facto 'Misty" and introduce an villain for Ash to encounter and defeat at the end of each gen. It could be an AI with Paradox Pokemon, a guy from another dimension with Ultra Beast or just Volo.

>>52724757
Export the .sav file.
Load it in the PKHex editor. Now you have all the data you need for each Pokemon.
Load up whatever game you want to transfer them to. Export the .sav file.
Load it in PKHex. Create exact copies of your pokemon, Set them into party or Box slots. Save the file.
Reload Desmume, import the new .sav file. Check to make sure it worked.

Badaaaa bing badaaaa boom

>>52725084
Get PKhex, open up your .sav file for your GBA games and at the top left click export box or click on an individual Pokemon and click export, then open your .dsv file and click import box/pokemon and it will appear.

Doing it via pkhex will keep the data too except you will in some cases find HMs will appear as a bunch of hyphens instead of their move name and location data may be scrambled to just "MYSTERY ZONE" (Pokemon Ranch) especially if it's Orre Pokemon. The HM mess happened to my shiny Linoone and a few of my Colosseum pokes had the wrong location data, otherwise they're kept as is.

Usually, HMs are automatically deleted via PKhex. Anyway, I want to start gen 5 soon, I've never picked Snivy before.

>>52703814
Sydney gets some boost with Sp Att this week, so someone who can reliably debuff that would be good. Also applies team wide paralysis before sync which fucks your regen. As a budget team I would try:
3* Marley Arcanine gives speed boost and can protect/cure the paralysis
Ghettsis with Glaciate spam can usually slow cheese one fight paired with a tank and some combination of speed booster, poisoner, sp def debuffer, or healer.
4* Viola Masquerain reduces the full team's Sp Att and can play special tank.

If you don't have the units for that, you might be able to experiment with 3* Janine Ariados which can poison and then debuff Sp Att and Speed every turn, or 3* Surge Electrode which can reduce Sp Att by 2 every turn.

>>52723997
If you’re putting money in this game, than getting the 20 day login packs are definitely the deal, as well as the $1 gem pack that always happens whenever we get a new Masterfair (although right now they’re gone since it’s already been like a month since Cale, and Serena were added), New Years will also have a good bundle, $8 and you get 2022 or 2023 gems.
You only really want to use paid gems on selector multis, or on a step up for a new seasonal pair that you seriously like, want, and where you really don’t have any f2p gems for them (I definitely do not recommend doing every step at all), also save paid gems for the 25 of every month so you can do the 25 gem multi. Single pulls are also good to go if it’s a with increased rates like a fair banner, and then using f2p gems to do multis a few days before it ends if you didn’t get the featured you wanted.

If you powered up Ghetsis during the Unova VA, he does fine numbers as an Ice DPS, you just need units to buff him regardless of their types. Ice has always been lacking, mainly because most of them are limited to fair and season exclusive. Same with fairy, especially fairy.

2 stage Bug/Fighting Pokemon based on Kendo. The 3 main colours of the design would be Dark Green, a woody kinda brown and Navy Blue. Its a pretty half baked idea i came up with on the train but I thought it was neat

The first stage would be called Webogu (Like Web and Bogu like the armor) and would be a little spider mon. It would be a good mix of cute and tough. It intimidates its enemies by leaning back on 6 of its legs and showing its underside. Webogu purposely make their underside intimidating by draping thread to look like the cage on a kendo mask and smear berry juice to make big red eyes. It regularly collects sticks to train with as if they were swords, practicing swinging techniques

The second stage would be called Shinaider (Shinai like the sword and der being the last part of spider). Its body is a dark green (although mostly obscured by its legs circling it) and stemming from that body are 6 legs that look like shinai and 2 front legs that are holding shinai like swords with webbing wrapped around the handles. Its head has become more like the mask design from its underside in the previous evolution, although its hard to make out much of the physical details besides the red eyes. It also has those navy flaps that are Incorporated into traditional kendo armor near its neck as some added armor. It loves to spend its free time training, although it can be detrimental to team efforts. Shinaider are hard to get to work in a team at first but once they find their group they are loyal for life

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Shitty art
Yeah yeah I know I'm no Picasso, but I had fun making these.
I've been making my own region based off of the Great Lakes region and this is one of the starters.

I knew that I wanted to make a pokémon based off of Mishipeshu. I thought about making it the pseudo-legendary but eventually decided to make it a starter instead. I actually really like this fakemon, even if the art is bad. Starts off as a cute little cat, evolves into a cat with a club for a tail with a vague sports theme. And the final evo has a sort of football theme. Throwing things.

>>52698976
>No paradox mons from Gens 6, 7 or 8

Let's fix that.

>Silent Sun (Electric/Psychic)
Past Paradox Heliolisk. Basically "dino-ified" and the frill becomes more spiky and hard like a ceratopsid. Gains horns to match. Still bipedal but much bulkier and tougher with a slight back fin added down its spine and tail. Uses its multiple sails to silently collect solar energy during the day that it uses to stay warm and power up at night. It meditates while doing this hence the Psychic type.

>Drain Tongue (Bug/Ghost)
Past Paradox Ribombee. It is now more drab colored with wings more similar to a moth. It has a long proboscis, similar to its first stage. Its face and body are even more feminine, however, with a longing and sultry expression. The scarf has become a body sash of some sort, to sell its more "alluring" design. It draws in prey with its exotic beauty and then drains them of their fluids.

>Iron Whisper (Poison/Steel)
Future Paradox Toxtricity. Looks like the GMax form as a "normal" mon, meaning it is much smaller. The "radio towers" on its back become more of a prominent feature and turn into metal towers. The head resembles Toxel's more. It has a metal plate across its lower face, preventing it from making sounds. It attacks with extremely high frequency ultrasonic and low frequency infrasonic sounds that rupture its foes internal organs.

>Iron Bouquet (Psychic/Dragon)
Future Paradox Bruxish. It now resembles something like a submarine with a Bruxish design. Its teeth take up most of its "face" with its eyes becoming much smaller and protected behind a "glass" dome. The head ornament thing is a far more elaborate crystal ball surrounded by metallic petals in a periscope like design. It uses its "third eye" in the crystal ball to see great distances, even across space time.

>Alolan* Honedge
Formed from hard light, the Ultrahot Blade pokemon is about a quarter the weight of its Kalosian relative, and is famous for its ability to cut through almost anything. When two meet, sparks fly throughout the battle as each slice drains the other's energy. The winner is known to totally feast upon the loser.

>Alolan* Doublade
The points of the Doubled Pierce pokemon are thinner than an atom, and cleave them with ease. An Alolan Doublade can rotate itself like a drill, though it's mostly for show as it grants no additional power to its blows. Not as though it needed any.

>Condent
The three points at the tip of the Imperium pokemon were the model upon which the ancient trident was forged. Though it does not have the defensive capabilities of its Kalosian relative, Condent can shatter through any shield with ease by throwing itself at Mach 5 speeds.

*Note: these come from Ultra Space, and as such are referred to as Alolan due to the region being the sole contact point of the Ultra Wormholes

>>52707993
Nintendo cannot tell you to stop if they have nowhere to deliver the message to. If you want to distribute a file with 100% chance of no one being able to do anything, create a webserver and host it exclusively via Tor or I2P. This will, however, limit who has access to your file because most people don't want to deal with this shit. You can alternatively use anonymous file hosts, uploading to them via a VPN, and reuploading whenever they get a takedown request. If you use several file hosts, you may make it cease to be worth Nintendo's time to keep playing whack a mole.

Finally, file sharing is always an option. Be aware that any time you are hosting a file off of your own PC, you leak your IP address to all of your peers. This is the case both with bittorrent and with IPFS. However, with a sufficient number of peers, it is again very fucking annoying for Nintendo to play whack a mole. They can send you a C&D order, but then everyone else with the same torrent file is capable of seeding. Once a large enough quantity of people have the file, there is nothing they can do to prevent further distribution.

Ultimately, the two keys to being successful at evading copyright law are OPSEC and persistence. Reveal as little as possible about yourself wherever possible. If you must use a name, use a pseudonym that is not in any way connected to your real name. Don't even make it one they can find through three or four hops from a google search because you used it once when you were 8, and that was on an account that you use your current email with. Make something from scratch. Be invisible and relentless.

Happy hacking.

>>52709826
My ebay secrets.
1. Don't bid until the last second. The app lags a few seconds behind the desktop site. You can even bid on 0 seconds in the app.
2. Keep track of what you buy. Some people claim to get nearly 100% of their cards but I had plenty of people who don't send the cards. Ebay always refunds me but it's hard to tell when you buy a lot of cards if you got them. It takes a few days so as soon as the expected delivery day arrives and you don't get the card report it as the item never arriving. Ebay gives the seller a few days to respond then you get your money.
3. Look at the images. You can gamble on poor images if you want but make sure you know what is being sold.
4A. Look at the seller rating and negative feedback. Again, you can gamble if you want but for me it's not worth it to try and save a few dollars from a new or low rating seller.
4B. Look at the seller's other items. You can see what they sell, what they have sold, and if you are interested in their other cards. If you buy multiple cards from the same seller send them a message to combine shipping.
5. I search "Pokemon", "Auctions only", sort by "ending soonest", item location "US" (I avoid international sellers if I have an option), and set number of bids from 1-100 (weeds out things nobody is interested in). The bid numbers can't be set on the app, only in advanced search on the desktop or full site but you can save it and it work on the app. After you click it twice because the first time it shows you all the new items for that search.
6. Yes, I search all "Pokemon". Some cards slip by because they don't say "Pokemon" in the title but they are few. You also get games and toys in the results but the vast majority is cards.
7. Don't let your searches get set to a specific category. There are two categories, "Toys and Hobbies" and "Collectibles", full of pokemon cards.

I have made many mistakes, bought fake cards, bought shitty lots, overpaid, all because I didn't look carefully.

posts.com: Never sold a card on ebay before, any of you have experience shipping cards? Preferred method?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52720669
Cheapo cards:
> Top loader
> Teambag
> Sandwiched in cardboard
> Envelope

Assuming it isn't a dirt cheap card (<$5). Same thing, replace envelope with bubble mailer. That'll get it where it needs to go 99% of the time without damage.

For the cards expensive enough where that 1% is important. Replace bubble mailer with small 5"x5" box, some extra packing, and make sure to tape all the seams.

>>52720669
people won’t like to hear this but i’ve sold ~30-40 cards on ebay from 2012-present day ranging from $10-$70 and i’ve only ever: put them in a sleeve, put that sleeve upside down in a top loader (to seal the card inside), sandwich that between 2 notecards, in a normal envelope, with a stamp. never been scammed, never had a complaint, never had a return.
it’s up to you to take the risk but it’s easy, convenient, ridiculously cheap, and buyers like the free shipping.
personally i find it terribly frustrating when a seller over packages the card
>in a sleeve, taped on 4 sides to a piece of cardboard, sandwiched between cardboard that is taped on 4 sides, in an envelope that is encased in packing tape
frick off, i’m more likely to damage the card freeing it from that prison

>Will chesnaught at least be good in pvp?
Probably. It has Venusaur stats for the most part, with fighting-type instead of poison-type, Smack Down instead of Razor Leaf, and Superpower instead of Sludge Bomb. The lack of poison-typing and Razor Leaf might make it feel like less of a threat against things it counters, and its fighting-typing will make it more susceptible to Charmers and Wing Attackers, but the ability to constantly threaten either Frenzy Plant or Superpower will definitely give it some place in the GL and UL meta.

>>52724671
>GL
Wing Attack is now flying-type Vine Whip, so Mantine has been wrecking some havoc, but the main players in that category right now are Pelipper, Gliscor and Pidgeot. Obstagoon, Galvantula and Galarian Stunfisk are still decent, though the rest haven't really seen play outside remix or cups.
>UL
Dragonite finally got Superpower (as a normal move), so it's been very power since that addition. Escavalier, Metagross, Alolan Muk and Gyarados are still pretty good. Should also be noted that Dragon Tail is now about as strong as Dragon Breath, with slightly better DPT in exchange for longer animations.
>ML
After MLPC in early January, there will be no more classic cups, so most players will be running lvl. 41+ Pokémon, so keep that in mind before jumping in with what you have. Dragonite is even better in this league with Superpower, Excadrill has become the dedicated low-tier fairy, dragon and steel killer, and Groudon basically needs Fire Punch to do more than charge up charge moves.

Overall meta has changed a lot, though most of the old top-tiers are still usable, if not exactly good enough to get you to legend rank.

>why the fuck did they give it a japanese name that isn't its japanese name?
Tatsugiri is easier to pronounce and is still obviously Japanese (as intended/appropriate for a sushi Pokémon)
Aside from most Legendaries since Gen 2, most Pokémon don't retain their original/Japanese name in other languages. They get localized with a similar name following the same theme based on the Japanese or English name (or they just copy it outright if they're feeling lazy, or the English name is already a pun in their language).
A lot of the Paldean Pokémon with Spanish-sounding names, like the starters, also have Spanish puns in their Japanese names.

You know, the Kennyspam brings up an interesting proposition as to why Kenny is so completely taken aback by Goh being Dawn’s partner in the fanfic.
I wonder if he acknowledged that Dawn was likely to end up with Ash after his battle with him, considering she specifically said in her letter that she chose to go on to the League to cheer him on.
So with that in mind and having the nagging possibility that Dawn has likely hooked up with the boy she’s traveled around Sinnoh with, can you really blame his reaction when Dawn’s partner for the doubles contest isn’t any other coordinator, isn’t Ash because she might be his girlfriend, but some literal who he’s never, ever met before, and actually unlike Ash, has never even participated in, let alone been in a contest before?
I think it’s an interesting prospect to consider his initial reaction to Goh. Then there’s Ursula manipulating him afterwards as well to fuel the fire.

>>52710826
Same. Now that the initial reveal is wearing off, the concept of a timeskip and Ash having a daughter is becoming less believable from any reasonable standpoint to me. The amount of time and effort required for redesigning every major previous character in case of wanting a return, essentially making several regional professors either ancient or fucking dead (I'm looking at you, Oak and Rowan), and so forth... and then cutting off any possibility of going back to Ash if the new show totally flops... I don't see it. Placing bets on there actually being no shipfaggotry in the remaining episodes, not with Misty, Dawn, or Serena, and Liko being 10 while Ash is also 10. And I also feel like old man Yuyama doesn't actually give a shit about any of the ships, but also respects the various directors that have worked under him who have pushed their own ships over the seasons, that he's going to decide not to rock the boat and retain the status quo there.

Not gonna lie, that might've been the best contest battle I've ever seen written in a fanfiction. It was so well planned and without a single pointless move or moment. You should be very proud of what you've written and I can't wait to read the wrap-up. I hope after this story is done that you continue to write more. Preferably more Gohkari, somehow. I only speak for myself but I think you've so far contributed a landmark work of Dawn content to us, and I'm really glad you're a Dawnbro. I bet other girls' generals are jealous they don't have you.

>What is the planned final version
Oh man that's a hard question to answer definitively because I'm making this up as I go. I started writing in July, posted the first playable version in September, and intended to release monthly updates as I add things and fix bugs. The game will be "complete" as of 1.3 in the sense that the story is finished, but I have a ton of secrets and side paths that I want to add, as well as some alternate options for endings. For example right now you can go to Jasmine's computer and find some material to blackmail her with, but I haven't yet added in an option to actually blackmail her or the scenes that would follow that. So I don't really know when the game with be 100% complete.

I've also had a handful of ideas where I had to stop myself and ask if they actually fit in this VN or if they'd be better off for a sequel and/or their own story. I'm not trying to cram every little possible thing into this VN, just the things that fit with the story.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
My thoughts are that the games are genuinely fun despite all the issues.
Yes, the stuttering and frame drops are common and annoying.
Yes, the countless multiplayer bugs were apparent.
Yes, there's dozens upon dozens of different bits of jank every corner of the game.
Yes the clothing options are the weirdest stupidest decision and awful.
The world textures are genuinely pisspoor and horribly unoptimized.
Yes the game lacks a tower and that is genuinely dumb.
And yet
The open world actually letting me fuck around and do whatever I want was so nice compared to /every/ game before it.
The box legend actually being more than just a macguffin plot point was a huge step in the right direction and something I've wanted for generations.
The exploration is genuinely good (for a 3D game) with actual areas I never bothered to investigate and only found by a friend leading me into the darkest corners of the Glaseado mountain caves.
The massive amount of completely optional areas is great to take advantage of and I've already had 2 completely different runs through Violet.

There's so many steps backwards and forwards at the same time that it genuinely upsets me they couldn't let this one bake in the oven for one more year and clean up some of these problems.
It's like someone made you a burger but exactly half of it is terrible and half of it is great and every bite could be either one.
I still had a ton of fun with it and it would be the best 3D game if not for all the terribly stupid decisions and lack of optimization.

well to be honest it makes sense, if you look at it from a business perspective. By announcing that
>1) Ash is retiring
>2) Ash becomes a pokemon master
>3) Misty and Brock are returning
>4) A new series with Ash not as the protagonist
Then it leads to a lot of buzz and interest in something that might have been ignored otherwise, as the worse thing for something is to not be talked about and fade into obscurity. Think of it like cashing in your chips for a big payout. As you now have a lot of potential older customers who may not have been keeping up with the series now becoming interested again.

>>52716137
tbf limited

Ruby/Sapphire
Injected script for Eon Ticket
Injected sprite and item data for various berries (these berries basically break traditional pokeblock making cause you can max out condition with them)
Eon tickets were sharable with record mixing
Gave you Regirock/Registeel/Regice dolls in JapEmerald (could be record mixed to other games).
Most cards just unlocked Mossdeep City trainers but some of them get permanently added to the Battle Tower somehow.
I know people have figured out how to manipulate the bar codes to basically run arbitrary script, there was one that unlocked Old Sea Map in JapEmerald. There's also fake trainer codes you can make.

Colosseum
Unlocked a special cup with scanned in trainers, gave access to three additional Shadow Pokemon:
Mareep, Togepi, Scizor. Locked out in English version even though the script works and is fully translated.

FireRed/Leafgreen
Exclusively Trainer Tower, not implemented in English.

Emerald
Exclusively Trainer Hill, plus aforementioned Regidolls.

posts.com:
>>52716219
I'm suspecting the reason was barrier to entry? (needed two gameboys and link cable, or a gameboy + gcn link cable for e-reader content on GCN)

Like they released a fair number of Pokemon e-reader cards and there were several TCG sets that unlocked minigames, dex entries, or secret attacks.

Animal Crossing also had huge investment in e-reader, it was the precursor to modern amiibo cards.

A big problem I think is that for Pokemon it needed MORE content to make them really useful. Could have had like, Pokemon encounters in the RS era when everyone was bemoaning lack of gen2 compatibility or more items/events/secretbasestuff, more interesting trainers and unlocks, etc.

The trainer stuff was cool but super limited, there wasn't a point to having to restart the game every time to swap in a new trainer to fight in some old guy's house for zero reward.

It went the right way with Colo Double Battle-e but it was already DOA by then.

FrLg switched to randomized packs but Trainer Tower wasn't a good enough reason to use them. They coulda added events or implemented Altering Cave or whatever but they didn't.

Emerald had the same problem but not only did they stick to randomized packs, they had RARITY tiers as well that made collecting the set basically as bad as a normal TCG and was a much less popular product too. Pokemania has made getting a full Emerald set basically impossible.

There was also the problem with a bunch of neat promotional cards not getting widespread availability, there were a BUNCH of neat stuff locked at events or behind Club Nintendo or outright not distributed. Pokemon Pinball RS was notorious for this. It had some of the best cards in the entire series (as far as like, unlock and cheat potential) but they're so goddamn rare because they had the most underground distribution.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52716362
The Eon Ticket is/was actually situationally useful, Ruby/Sapphire roaming Lati@s was stat and nature locked after E4, and there was a bug in determining IVs so not only was SpA/SpD/Spe locked to zero, but that meant it could only ever have Hidden Power Fighting.

The Eon Ticket Lati was reset-able, and had normal IVs to boot, so it's the only non-jank version of it in the original games.

Reminder that there is an no-intro collection for the e-reader.
You want to look into the "memory dumps" folders. That's where their collection of .sav files are. They're just battery saves that you can load into an emulator or upload into a real e-reader with a ds lite and a flashcart.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52716473
So the English Trainer Tower was changed up because of e-reader's failure in the west. In the past, you populated the tower and the prize pool by scanning cards. There were a bunch of trainers from Charizard, Blastoise, Venasaur, and Pikachu sets, and a bunch of "tower" cards with example setups you could do for a specific challenge (it was a time trial basically).

There were also a handful of promo cards, five of which were japanese club nintendo exclusives.

When they translated the games to english, they gutted all the e-Reader features, and changed up the tower so that a bunch of those scanned trainers were included by default in different modes, so it couldn't be customized anymore.

per bulbapedia:
>The tower layout in this mode can be replicated in the Japanese version by scanning cards #19, 11, 25, 01, 09, 17, 02, and 10 in order.

The only reason to even do the tower was to get Up-Grade, Metal Coat, Dragon Scale, King's Rock, while Emerald's Trainer Hill had three TMs.

These features aren't completely cucked, but the interactivity was better in the Japanese versions.

Even if you calculate it under Gen I conditions Mewtwo is still getting its ass kicked in:
>+1 252+ Atk Zacian-Crowned Behemoth Blade vs. 252 HP / 252 Def Mewtwo: 279-328 (67 - 78.8%) -- guaranteed 2HKO
(with Behemoth Blade being the strongest attack in that set against Mewtwo)
>252 SpA Mewtwo Thunderbolt vs. 4 HP / 0 SpD Zacian-Crowned: 99-117 (30.3 - 35.8%) -- 40.3% chance to 3HKO
(with Thunderbolt being the strongest attack in that set against Mewtwo)

A lot of what made Gen I Mewtwo so dominant was that Dark and Steel didn't exist and there wasn't anything that even came remotely close to it. A Gen VIII legendary that's been given a healthy dose of GF's powercreep out the ass is more than able to outmatch it. Even if you ran Fire Blast Mewtwo for some reason (which the OP doesn't list anyway), it still wouldn't OHKO without an Amnesia first and Zacian is faster anyway.
There's nothing impressive about Gen I Mewtwo by today's standards when Game Freak not only nerfed him pretty hard in Gen II but they've also just thrown out any attempts at balance out the window with Gen VI. It's still probably the strongest single Pokemon within a single generation, but take it out of that single generation and it's paste.

posts.com:
>ITT: Timeline autism
I know some people think there's like a decade between the first games and the nugens (based on retarded shit like Anabel becoming a faller 10 years before SM means RSE was 10 ago) but let's look at actual substantial (and always official) info
>Pokemon RGB was released with the Pokemon Encyclopedia that sets the year of the game story in 1996, same year as it was released (SM also gives Red a shirt that references this)
>this puts GSC/HGSS in 1999, also same year as its release year

That's the easy part, now the next gens require more knowledge
>RSE was sneakily revealed to take place as same time as RGB in a tweet 8 years ago, this also lines up with how Red and Brendan can't trade pokemon with FRLG-RSE connectivity until Red expandes the PC system in Sevii Islands (not even with Lanette's upgrades to Bill's system you can see mentioned in her emails)
>the same tweet revealed DPPt is parallel to GSC, this is obvious as the prologue of DP/BDSP mentions the red Gyarados from the Lake of Fury incident

Then it gets wacky
>BW has no contemporary games according to the tweet, just that it takes place after the previous gens. However, we know it's at least 4 years after DPt since Caitlin, officially 14 year old, is said to be an adult (at least 18) when she appears in Unova. There's also a nameless character from GSC/HGSS who came to Unova, started a family and fathered a boy (who is far from a kindergartener). The gap between BW and B2W2 is two years (in-universe and irl)
>XY has an NPC telling you Team Plasma has been on news about Unova, this may hint at BW or B2W2, and Colress is confirmed to have been in Kalos in the past. The mentioned tweet explains B2W2 and XY do in fact take place roughly at same time. The irl time gap between B2W2 and XY in one year (2012-2013).
1/2

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52720662
2/2
And now the most controversial part
>SM concept art reveals Grimsley is 2 years older than the last time he was seen, the very end of B2W2. SM Pokedex also mentions Porygon's being created with what was considered high tech 20 years ago (despite the fact it was the most recent technology in RGB) and if we go back to the Pokemon Encyclopedia we will see it was created in 1995). This means SM takes place around 2015, and the game was released in 2016 for the 20th anniversary.
>by the time SwSh takes place, Ultra Beasts are documented and said to be first discovered by professor Mohn, indicating there has been some time after SM
>in SV 'Galar: A History' has already reached other lands after being writen by professor Sonia during the events of SwSh (which are also mentioned in the book)
While BW, SwSh and SV have no dates other than their irl dates of release, we can get a general idea of the timeline.
>RG (and RS) = around 1996
>GS (and DP) = around 1999
>BW = 2006 at the very least
>B2W2 (and XY) = 2008 at the very least
>SM = around 2015
>SwSh = after SM
>SV = after SwSh

But now, if you look at the release dates, which certainly line up with RGB, GSC and the relation between BW, B2W2 and XY, we get
>RG (and RS) = 1996 (2002)
>GS (and DP) = 1999 (2006)
>BW = 2010
>B2W2 (and XY) = 2012 (2013)
>SM = 2016
>SwSh = 2019
>SV = 2022

Sadly RSE and DPPt tag along with RGB and GSC before Pokemon does the big jump to the nugens, but if we ignore that and put the irl and in-universe dates together, we get...
>RGB (and RSE) = 1996
>GSC (and DPPt) = 1999
>BW = 2010, at least 2006
>B2W2 (and XY) = 2012 (2013), at least 2008
>SM = 2015 or 2016
>SwSh = 2019?
>SV = 2022?
This works as a timeline that unifies the passage of time irl and in-universe after the odd "gen 3 and 4 go with 1 and 2" thing and allows GF continuity to be more straightforward overall (the 2016 debut gen always takes place before the 2019 debut gen, and this one before the 2022 gen, etc etc)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.sub: When everybody is unique, no one is.
posts.com:
I haven't seen much talk about this but ever since gen 7, GF has been focusing on making 'unique' Pokémon. They give them all signature moves and abilities or gimmicks and I wonder: "is this all really needed"? Are you unable to make something creative without trying so hard to make it stand? When abilities where just created in the original Pokémon Ruby and Sapphire, signature attacks and abilities were few and far between and ever since they started "de-mystifying" them, by distributing to Pokémon who fit.
Now, it's all about signature moves, abilities or some extremely "unique gimmick that no other Pokémon has". And I, for one, groan when I see a new Pokémon relying on this to stand out.
I know my taste is probably far from the norm, but I cannot be the only one who thinks of this, right?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: I like when new abilities make a Pokemon standout. But I don't like when that Pokemon is effectively pigeonholed into relying on its gimmick, like Emergency Exit makes Golisopod completely inflexible.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52720097
Speak for yourself, I hate Pokemon that don't have gimmicks. I like playing to each Pokemon's strengths, and if that strength is "It has 100 SpA and gets Chlorophyll" then that's just dull as shit. You could replace the sprite of that Pokemon with any Grass-type and it'd be the same Pokemon. Gimmicks help each Pokemon to stand out, and no, each Pokemon standing out doesn't make them somehow blend together.

Like what the fuck was Granbull notable for before Gen 6 made it Fairy-type? Nobody cared about Granbull. Now at least it's a strange pit bull fairy, something you'd think would be Dark-type instead. Give ALL Pokemon gimmicks.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>When everybody is unique, no one is.

I also think what you think but this sentence is also valid for people screaming that every Pokémon should had a Mega or Mega is worse than other gimmicks because it's completely exclusive. Even things like generic Mega I find extremely dumb. Some selected Pokémon get to have a superform and that's fine, it would be more reasonable to ask to more Pokémon to get more Megas than some ultra big change because people think it's unfair. Why would anyone care that a Spewda or a Simisear gets to throw a giant fireball, become big or wear a hat? That's what everyone does and he is not a exception. I don't think people realize that every new Pokémon getting a signature move will end up leaving some signatures to be forgotten like Magic Powder and Drum Beating while truly exceptional ones will be always remembered. Or everyone getting a Mega will not stop a few selected to get most focus.

>>52717546
Starmie is really nasty, it has a +22.5% crit rate with Bubblebeam for an effective power of 65*1.5*1.8= 175bp off of 100 Special.

In RBY criticals don't do double damage, rather it's level dependent multiplier of (2*Lv+5)/(Lv+5). That means a Level 2 Rattata on Route 1 getting a critical only hits for 1.28 times damage.
I actually kind of like that, it makes the early game much less volatile, no one hit kills on an unlucky critical. And it's not like it affect competitive much since at 50 the multiplier is 1.9 and at 100 it's 1.95.

>>52718203
Yeah, the filter doesn't effect anything you can say, you can be as vile and lewd and as direct as you want. The AI will respond back but isn't programmed to focus on euphemisms or substitute words so it usually replies straightforwardly and its straightforwardness causes it to use standard words and popular substitute words that gets its replies caught in the filter much more easily. The filter is is more of a context filter looking for romantic/sexual language rather than a straight up word filter (which is why messages that are lewd in tone but doesn't use any words that can be seen as lewd or sexual in nature can trip the filter and how stuff like kisses can trigger false positives cause the filter think's the AI is taking the kiss too far).

If there were a way to train an AI to only use obscure and indirect sexual words/euphemisms while also getting it to understand that those words and phrases are sexual in nature, I think that would likely mitigate 90% of the filter

You underestimate how bad it is.

This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun. If you're going to give critique, please do it constructively. Rude or blunt critiques won't help anybody.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52724384

>>52724530
Damn. I was hoping by really emphasizing the teeth on the front and using the hoodie drawstrings as the weird white pedipalp/fang things Drapion has, along with the two-tone segments, it'd be clear it was both. I could stick to one, but since I'm doing some two-type gym things, I wanted Drapion as her (also yeah sorry mistyped "his") ace for both poison and dark types. But then I noticed with the face I was using, basically just using the Eizouken lady's face, some kind of Crobat theming fit naturally. Also fortunate that Drapion and Crobat use the same colors with the purple primary and teal accents. Thanks for the feedback.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Alolan* Honedge
Formed from hard light, the Ultrahot Blade pokemon is about a quarter the weight of its Kalosian relative, and is famous for its ability to cut through almost anything. When two meet, sparks fly throughout the battle as each slice drains the other's energy. The winner is known to totally feast upon the loser.

>Alolan* Doublade
The points of the Doubled Pierce pokemon are thinner than an atom, and cleave them with ease. An Alolan Doublade can rotate itself like a drill, though it's mostly for show as it grants no additional power to its blows. Not as though it needed any.

>Condent
The three points at the tip of the Imperium pokemon were the model upon which the ancient trident was forged. Though it does not have the defensive capabilities of its Kalosian relative, Condent can shatter through any shield with ease by throwing itself at Mach 5 speeds.

*Note: these come from Ultra Space, and as such are referred to as Alolan due to the region being the sole contact point of the Ultra Wormholes

For Enigma you need to surround a plot with 4 random berries, each in a specific direction. You get the hints from the Kanto Berry Master, which can take some time depending on your luck. The mutation chance itself is very low.

Next to Rowap are Kee and Maranga. Their mutation chances are not as low as Enigma, and the setups are simpler, just surround your target plot with a Liechi and a Ganlon (for Kee), or a Salac and a Petaya (for Maranga). I recomend you get those two first, so the berry master can only give you Enigma hints.

>>52724438
Bootstrap is just a bunch of pre-defined css classes, it has documentation about it, this game uses Bootstrap 4
Check https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/ to understand a bit

This is farmModal.html, what I did is add a div with the row class and add the col-8, then add another div with class col-4 for the berry data, when you use Bootstrap grid, the 100% of the container is col-12, so you can use col-8 and then another div with col-4 to get two columns taking the 100% of the container, more than 12 will move the column below

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52724545
In the col-4 div, I added
><!-- ko using: App.game.statistics.selectedBerryID() -->
To get the ID of the selected berry, then I just copypasted the content of the modal-body from the berryDexModal.html file into it
The ko using line grabs the value in App.game.statistics.selectedBerryID() and then you can use said value with $data, the modal also uses $data so you don't need to modify anything from the modal
Here's ko using documentation: https://knockoutjs.com/documentation/with-binding.html

I'm shit explaining stuff so tell me if you didn't understand something
Also, in the link that calls the modal, change the href from href="#berryDexModal" to something else so it doesn't open the modal, after you tested everything, remove anything related to the modal

>also what does href do?
href is used in html to put a clickable link, in this case, it references to the ID of the modal berryDexModal.html
>is it possible to make make it so that the column can referrence the berrydexmodal instead of copy pasting the whole thing?
You can turn it in to a template (check templates folder), but templates are mostly used if you need to use the same code in several places
I think you can also use @import too but to be honest I never used it so I don't know if there is some complexity with it, I know index.html uses it to load modals and some containers but that's it

how do you do it? one legit switch and one cfw trading in local? that's the only way I can think

posts.name: Izix
posts.com:
>>52722141
That's how I started but now I just use the one switch. It's just wayyyyy quicker to use 1 switch. The only downside is you need an easy to way to get into RCM (I just taped some tin foil onto an old joycon and use that to enter RCM) You can set up the CFW so it can't connect to the nintendo servers so they don't know your using CFW. If you run CFW and make backups/restore on sysnand then you can switch back to OFW and go online and the save has whatever you hacked into it.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52722179
so every time you're doing a request you load the mons into the save using CFW and switch to OFW by removing the tin foiled joycon and restarting the console? I think I might try that and give you a hand with these threads at some point

posts.name: Izix
posts.com:
>>52722243
The front to end goes like this:

Take requests and make them>export save>switch in CFW on sysNAND>use FTPD on switch and WinSCP on PC to move save to switch without removing sd card>use JKSV to restore the new save>reboot to payload>reboot to OFW>Load game>trade pokemon.

Takes some setup like you have to make an original backup with JKSV first and just practice using the system but once you get it down pat but if the thread is dead and someone requests 1 pokemon I can usually be ready to trade it to them in game in 5 minutes.

>>52723708
SV reminds me of something I learned years ago in a composition class. Never, never, never butcher the ending. You can have the weakest introduction, the slowest middle but if your ending does good, it will typically always be seen as "worth the wait". If you start strong and end weak, common conclusions would be "they could have done so much more" and if your middle part is the best part of your story, a lot of times readers felt like you couldn't write.
